decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Phyrexian Unlife to draw cards and win the game through a massive life loss from casting Ad Nauseam. It uses various cantrips and mana acceleration tools like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to set up the combo quickly while keeping the player alive with Pact of Negation and Slaughter Pact. The deck also includes some control elements with counterspells and versatile tutor effects to ensure the combo goes off smoothly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the battlefield with cheap artifacts and use them to power up creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Vault Skirge, while utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Ensoul Artifact to buff them even further. Steel Overseer and Springleaf Drum help to generate additional value and permit explosive turns. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and synergy between its artifact creatures, ultimately seeking to close out games swiftly through combat damage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifact creatures and equipment, then use cards like Galvanic Blast and Cranial Plating to deal damage to the opponent. Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum help accelerate mana production, while Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager can quickly pump up your creatures. The deck also features evasion through Inkmoth Nexus and Signal Pest, and protection with cards like Etched Champion. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy fueled by the affinity mechanic.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with small artifact creatures and use various equipment cards like Cranial Plating to buff their power and toughness. The deck focuses on dealing fast, aggressive damage to the opponent by attacking with multiple creatures each turn. It also utilizes cards like Galvanic Blast and Shrapnel Blast as removal and burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent. With cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to pump up its creatures even further to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful, hexproof creature by stacking it with auras that enhance its abilities and protect it from removal spells. By utilizing cards like Gladecover Scout and Kor Spiritdancer alongside a variety of enchantments such as Daybreak Coronet, Rancor, and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large, untargetable creature that can deal significant damage each turn. This strategy focuses on maintaining board presence and increasing the power of the creature rapidly to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a strong and untargetable creature by enchanting it with powerful auras. By giving the creature hexproof and boosting its power and toughness, it becomes difficult for opponents to deal with, allowing for aggressive attacks and quick victories. The deck is built around protecting and enhancing a single creature to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to mount a defense. The mana base supports the aggressive strategy by enabling quick access to the necessary colors for casting auras.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. This allows for a variety of combos and synergies to be utilized, such as creating infinite creature tokens with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch. The deck also has control elements with cards like Glen Elendra Archmage and Linvala, Keeper of Silence to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the creatures and spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with different abilities to generate value and control the board through a combination of toolbox creatures and sac outlets. By utilizing cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the deck is able to tutor for specific creatures to answer threats, gain life, disrupt opponents, and generate win conditions. The deck aims to create a flexible and adaptable game plan by utilizing a diverse selection of creatures with varying effects to outmaneuver opponents and grind out incremental advantages over time.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a huge amount of mana, allowing for powerful late-game threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Wurmcoil Engine to be cast quickly. Control elements like Karn Liberated and Oblivion Stone help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and land tutoring, ensuring consistency in executing its game plan. Overall, the key concept revolves around generating massive mana advantage to play high-impact threats and control the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans by using cards like Leonin Arbiter and Aven Mindcensor to limit their search abilities, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Blade Splicer. The deck also utilizes the flicker ability of Restoration Angel and Flickerwisp to generate additional value from enters-the-battlefield triggers. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play quickly, while cards like Path to Exile provide removal options. Overall, this deck aims to control the game while slowly chipping away at the opponent's life total.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficient removal spells to control the board while deploying high-value threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. With a solid mana base and powerful cards like Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in a fast-paced Modern format. Thrun, the Last Troll provides a resilient threat against control decks, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay keep the opponent's board in check. Overall, this deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats.

This deck utilizes a combination of efficient removal spells, disruption, and powerful creatures to put pressure on the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to close out the game swiftly. The deck also has a strong mana base to support its three-color requirements, allowing for a consistent and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Pyromaster provide additional value and control options.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Dismember to deal with threats on the board. It also includes powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also has a strong grind game with cards like Lingering Souls and Liliana of the Veil. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of black, green, and white, with utility lands like Tectonic Edge to disrupt opposing lands.

The Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, combined with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Dismember to deal with opposing threats. The overall strategy is to control the game early and then close it out with powerful creatures and planeswalkers.

This deck focuses on applying pressure early on with efficient and resilient creatures like Dark Confidant and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also has removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse to handle threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Garruk Wildspeaker provide additional value and ways to close out games. The deck aims to have a strong aggressive game plan while also being able to disrupt opponents and handle a variety of threats.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand while applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. Lingering Souls provides a constant stream of flying tokens, while cards like Abrupt Decay and Putrefy handle problematic permanents. The deck aims to establish an early board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption and card advantage to secure the win.

The deck focuses on an aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, backed up by disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and control while Lingering Souls provides a recurring source of threats. The mana base supports the deck's three-color requirements with fetch lands and dual lands, with some utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Twilight Mire. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early while disrupting the opponent's game plan, gradually grinding them out for a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Martyr of Sands ability to gain a large amount of life quickly, while controlling the board with cards like Ghostly Prison and Path to Exile. The deck also focuses on aggressive creatures like Serra Ascendant and Ranger of Eos to pressure the opponent and seal the game with cards like Batterskull and Emeria, the Sky Ruin. The sideboard may include cards to further control the opponent or disrupt their strategy, allowing the deck to adapt to different matchups and maximize its aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By using cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas, the deck aims to control the board while consistently putting pressure on the opponent. Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis boost the power of all Merfolk creatures, while cards like Cursecatcher and Spell Pierce provide disruption to opponent's game plan. With a focus on tempo and synergy between Merfolk creatures, this deck aims to swiftly defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, maximizing damage output early in the game. The mana base consists of red sources to ensure consistency in casting spells. Cards like Searing Blaze, Lightning Bolt, and Shard Volley provide removal and direct damage, while creatures like Ash Zealot and Goblin Guide put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain board control and tempo by using powerful and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Electrolyze, and Remand, while utilizing Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets as aggressive threats. The inclusion of countermagic like Spell Snare, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command helps to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect your own creatures. Card advantage is gained through Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions, with Vendilion Clique providing additional disruption. The mana base is optimized for flexibility and consistency, allowing for a smooth curve of proactive plays.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal while ramping up mana with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow. The primary win condition is to play Scapeshift and sacrifice lands to fetch multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, dealing a lethal amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and various cantrips to dig for key cards. It aims to outlast the opponent and win through a powerful combo finish.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand while utilizing efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure on the battlefield. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and removal, while cards like Fulminator Mage and Tectonic Edge help in disrupting the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying consistent pressure to secure victory in a fast-paced format like Modern 1 vs 1.

This deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's hand while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with threats. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and removal, while cards like Courser of Kruphix and Dark Confidant help generate card advantage. The deck aims to control the game through targeted discard spells and removal, while beating down the opponent with powerful creatures.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck aims to apply pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze, backed up by powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. By combining disruptive elements with strong threats, this deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent and maintaining control of the board.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch/Pestermite to create infinite hasty creature tokens, overwhelming the opponent quickly. It includes various control elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes card advantage through Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage to find the combo pieces efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the combo with access to both red and blue mana sources.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using the cards Splinter Twin, Deceiver Exarch, and Pestermite to create infinite tokens and attack for lethal damage. The deck also includes control elements like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Lightning Bolt to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additional value cards like Tarmogoyf, Huntmaster of the Fells, and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while controlling the board, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful win condition.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, and Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses control elements like Remand, Condescend, and Repeal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while searching for key pieces such as Mindslaver, Platinum Angel, or Wurmcoil Engine to stabilize the board. The deck also has card draw and tutoring abilities to find the necessary cards to ensure victory. Additionally, it includes ways to recur important artifacts with Academy Ruins and protect against threats with Oblivion Stone.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Mine, and Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. It uses control elements such as counterspells (Condescend, Remand), removal (Dismember, Oblivion Stone), and card draw (Thirst for Knowledge) to control the game. The deck can tutor for key artifacts with Expedition Map and Fabricate, and win conditions include big artifacts like Batterskull, Wurmcoil Engine, and Platinum Angel. The deck also has a lockout combo potential with Mindslaver and Academy Ruins.

This deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and out-value the opponent. It has a strong mana base with dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana. The win conditions include efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage, powerful planeswalkers like Keranos, and versatile lands like Celestial Colonnade. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining card advantage, this deck aims to grind out wins in a long game.

This deck focuses on using a combination of control cards and powerful midrange creatures to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By leveraging counterspells like Cryptic Command and Mana Leak, along with removal like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board while deploying threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Restoration Angel to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Sphinx's Revelation allows for additional card advantage and versatility, making it a versatile and well-rounded control deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, removal, and value creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel. The key concept is to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cryptic Command and Path to Exile. Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker offers a combo finish with Restoration Angel, providing a powerful win condition. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient answers, ultimately grinding out a victory through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt opponent's plans, while also utilizing card advantage through cantrips and Snapcaster Mage. It can also generate value and tempo advantage by flickering creatures like Restoration Angel and Wall of Omens. The deck features a combo finish with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Restoration Angel, providing a way to close out games quickly. The manabase is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells and abilities in the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent with efficient removal spells and powerful card advantage engines like Sphinx's Revelation. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while generating value through Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel's flash abilities. The deck also has a strong late-game plan with Celestial Colonnade and threats like Keranos, God of Storms. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's pace and grind out incremental advantages until securing a win.
